intro: Laserpitium nestleri var. hispidum, commonly known as the hispid Lasur, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
